summary: An FBI New York Field Office request for high-priority assistance from the Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART) to decrypt a FileVault II encrypted 1TB external hard drive seized pursuant to a July 2019 search warrant in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The document states the case involves victims sexually abused by Epstein in the mid-2000s.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the individual who sexually abused several victims in the mid-2000s by inviting minors to his residences for massages that turned sexual.

events.title: Search Warrant Issued
events.description: A search warrant was issued by the Southern District of New York, authorizing the seizure of evidence.

events.title: Sexual Abuse of Minors
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein invited minors to his residences, including one in Manhattan, and paid them for massages that turned sexual in nature.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively examining encrypted digital evidence (a 1TB Seagate external hard drive) in the Epstein case as of August 2019.
The evidence was seized under a search warrant issued by the Southern District of New York on July 11, 2019.
The case background describes Epstein sexually abusing several victims in the mid-2000s by inviting minors to his residences for paid massages that became sexual.
The hard drive was encrypted with FileVault II, and no passwords had been discovered at the time of the request.
The request was marked as high priority due to the high-profile nature of the case.
